title: Gothic for peace, justice, etc.
content:
OK, I thought that the name of this font was Commercial Gothic. Now I can’t even find that a font by that name even exists. Besides the fact that I’m losing my mind, does anyone know the name of this font? Any help is appreciated, especially before Altzheimer’s sets in.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122074148im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/peace_5194.gif)

 [‹ Really bad font](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122074148/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48444 "Go to previous forum topic") [Can anyone ID this movie poster font please ? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122074148/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48541 "Go to next forum topic")
author: rickruss

comments.content:
<cite>OK, I thought that the name of this font was Commercial Gothic.</cite>  
There is a freeware font calling itself [Media Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122074148/http:/www.dafont.com/media-gothic.font) which looks like a copy of Engravers Gothic given a slightly heavier weight. They haven’t even bothered to give it numerals.

Did you find this old thread when searching “commercial gothic”?

[http://typophile.com/node/16092](http://web.archive.org/web/20081122074148/http:/typophile.com/node/16092)
Media Gothic is similar, but not the same. Look at the diagonals of the M, for example.
Looks like ATSackers Gothic Medium to me. At least at first glance. May be something slightly different, but I haven’t examined it very thoroughly yet.
